pullRequest.title: feat: Implement firebase-crashlytics-ktx
pullRequest.bodyText:
Adding Kotlin Extensions for the new Crashlytics SDK :)
Not only this allows to use Firebase.crashlytics, but also setting custom keys:
Firebase.crashlytics.setCustomKeys(
    "str_key" to "hello",
    "bool_key" to true,
    "int_key" to 1,
    "long_key" to 1L,
    "float_key" to 1.0f,
    "double_key" to 1.0
)

nodes.bodyText:
This is definitely an improvement compared to using plain java api, a few considerations though:

Some other ktx sdks use dsl-like notation for similar use-cases, e.g. Firebase.analytics.logEvent, so it might make sense to something similar here for the sake of consistency. The dsl could even support infix notation like Pair does(not sure if it would be a good idea though).
The dsl would also be more type-safe, i.e. there won't be a need for IllegalArgumentException below, as the block can be made to only have the methods with argument types crashlytics supports.

So I would suggest something along the lines of:
crashlytics.setCustomKeys {
  key("foo", "bar")
  key("int", 42)
  // or
  "foo" to "bar" // this might not be a good idea as it shadows the Pair constructor function.
}
wdyt?
